[[=image Shears.PNG width=50%]]
> "Are... are you sure? I, I'm not sure I can do that."

You tell her she can. That you'll be here, you'll help her out. You try to motivate her as you focus on hiding the waver in your voice. 

> "Okay. I- I can do this."

She smiles.

> "Thank you."

It's so real it feels like you could reach through the TV screen. You wish you could so you could help more.

Shears in hand, she makes her way upstairs. 

It's there. Waiting.

She charges, shears held with both hands. She swings from the right.

It dodges.

It responds by lunging the knife forward, but she dodges too -- the knife ends up embodied in the drywall. You feel it: //hope//.

Focused on extracting the knife from the wall, its monolithic, overall-covered form faces away from the girl. She sees the opportunity and takes it, rushing forward.

It's a ruse. The entity turns around and sidesteps, grabbing the shears as it does, swinging the girl into the wall. She falls to the floor.

It raises a kitchen knife.

You dig your nails into your palms and scream with frustration.

The girl screams too. 

The tape cuts to black.

You scream till your throat is hoarse in a futile effort to expel your frustration and sorrow. Blood drips from your palms.

= It always ends the same.
